meanings.definition: The act of terminating something before it is due or expected to end.
meanings.sent1: The preterminations of the project caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent2: The preterminations of the lease agreement led to legal disputes.
meanings.sent3: The preterminations of the party left everyone hanging without cake.
meanings.sent4: His preterminations of the conversation cut off any chance for reconciliation.
meanings.sent5: The preterminations of the movie plot left the audience in suspense.

meanings.definition: The state of being terminated prematurely.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected preterminations of the contract shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The preterminations of the game due to bad weather disappointed the fans.
meanings.sent3: The preterminations of the vacation left them stranded at the airport.
meanings.sent4: The preterminations of the flower's bloom symbolized the fleeting nature of beauty.
meanings.sent5: The sudden preterminations of the concert left the audience wanting more.
